Package com.dua3.utility.lang

Class LangUtil

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.lang.LangUtil
public final class LangUtil extends Object
A Utility class with general purpose methods.

  • Method Details

    • checkArg

      public static <T> void checkArg(String argName, Predicate<T> condition, T value)
      Validates the provided argument based on the specified condition. If the condition is not met, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown with a descriptive message.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the argument to validate.
      Parameters:
      argName - The name of the argument being validated. Used for logging or debugging purposes.
      condition - A Predicate representing the condition that the argument must satisfy.
      value - The value of the argument to validate against the specified condition.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided value does not satisfy the condition.

    • checkArg

      public static void checkArg(boolean condition, Supplier<String> msg) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates the provided boolean condition and throws an IllegalArgumentException with the specified message if the condition is false.
      Parameters:
      condition - the boolean condition to be checked
      msg - a supplier that provides the exception message if the condition is false
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the condition is false

    • checkArg

      public static void checkArg(boolean condition, String fmt, Object... fmtArgs) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Checks a condition and throws an IllegalArgumentException with a formatted message if the condition is false.
      Parameters:
      condition - the boolean condition to check; if false, an exception is thrown
      fmt - the format string used to construct the exception message
      fmtArgs - the arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified condition is false

      Check that condition is fulfilled.
      Parameters:
      condition - condition to test
      Throws:
      LangUtil.FailedCheckException - if condition does not evaluate to true

      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:

      Throws:

      fmtArgs - format arguments

    • ignore

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object> void ignore(T arg)
      Do nothing.

      This method does exactly nothing. Its purpose is to keep static code analysis tools happy that complain about ignored return values of methods like BufferedReader.readLine(). Use this method to explicitly ignore the return value and avoid false positives from static code checkers.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the parameter type
      Parameters:
      arg - the variable to ignore

    • asUnmodifiableList

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends @Nullable Object> List<T> asUnmodifiableList(T... args)
      Returns a fixed-size list backed by the specified array. The returned list is immutable and any attempt to modify it will result in an UnsupportedOperationException.

      In contrast to List.of(Object[]), this method supports null elements.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the class of the elements in the array
      Parameters:
      args - the array by which the list will be backed
      Returns:
      an immutable list containing the specified elements

    • isOneOf

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends @Nullable Object> boolean isOneOf(T arg, T... rest)
      Test if first argument is equal to one of the other arguments.
      Type Parameters:
      T - argument type
      Parameters:
      arg - first argument
      rest - remaining arguments
      Returns:
      true, if rest contains at least one item that is equal to arg

    • isNoneOf

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends @Nullable Object> boolean isNoneOf(T arg, T... rest)
      Test if first argument is not equal to any of the other arguments.
      Type Parameters:
      T - argument type
      Parameters:
      arg - first argument
      rest - remaining arguments
      Returns:

    • orElse

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object> T orElse(@Nullable T a, T b)
      Return first argument if non-null, second argument otherwise.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type
      Parameters:
      a - the first argument
      b - the second argument
      Returns:
      a, if a != null, else b

    • orElseGet

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type
      Parameters:
      a - the first argument
      b - the supplier in case a==null
      Returns:
      a, if a != null, else b.get()

    • uncheckedConsumer

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object, E extends Exception> Consumer<T> uncheckedConsumer(LangUtil.ConsumerThrows<T,E> c)
      Helper method that converts checked IOException to UncheckedIOException and other checked exceptions to WrappedException.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the argument type
      E - the exception type
      Parameters:
      c - the consumer to call (instance of LangUtil.ConsumerThrows)
      Returns:
      instance of Consumer that invokes f and converts IOException to UncheckedIOException, CheckedException to WrappedException, and lets UncheckedExceptions through
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if RuntimeException is thrown during execution of the argument passed
      UncheckedIOException - if IOException is thrown during execution of the argument passed
      WrappedException - if any other type of Exception is thrown during execution of the argument passed

    • uncheckedSupplier

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object, E extends Exception> Supplier<T> uncheckedSupplier(LangUtil.SupplierThrows<? extends T,E> s)
      Helper method that converts checked IOException to UncheckedIOException and other checked exceptions to WrappedException.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the argument type
      E - the exception type
      Parameters:
      s - the supplier to call (instance of LangUtil.SupplierThrows)
      Returns:
      instance of Supplier that invokes f and converts IOException to UncheckedIOException, CheckedException to WrappedException, and lets UncheckedExceptions through
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if RuntimeException is thrown during execution of the argument passed
      UncheckedIOException - if IOException is thrown during execution of the argument passed
      WrappedException - if any other type of Exception is thrown during execution of the argument passed

    • uncheckedFunction

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object, R extends @Nullable Object, E extends Exception> Function<T,R> uncheckedFunction(LangUtil.FunctionThrows<T,R,E> f)
      Helper method that converts checked IOException to UncheckedIOException and other checked exceptions to WrappedException.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the argument type
      R - the result type
      E - the exception type
      Parameters:
      f - the function to call (instance of LangUtil.FunctionThrows)
      Returns:
      instance of Function that invokes f and converts IOException to UncheckedIOException and other checked exceptions to WrappedException
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if RuntimeException is thrown during execution of the argument passed
      UncheckedIOException - if IOException is thrown during execution of the argument passed
      WrappedException - if any other type of Exception is thrown during execution of the argument passed

    • map

      public static <T, U extends @Nullable Object> U map(@Nullable T t, Function<? super @Nullable T,U> f)
      Applies a mapping function to the given input and returns the result. If the input is null, this method will return null without applying the function.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input
      U - the type of the output
      Parameters:
      t - the input value, which may be null
      f - the mapping function to apply to the input, must accept and produce possibly nullable values
      Returns:
      the result of applying the mapping function to the input, or null if the input is null

    • cache

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object> Supplier<T> cache(Supplier<T> supplier)
      Create a lazy, caching Supplier. Upon first invocation of `get()`, `s.get()` is called to create the object to be returned. Each subsequent call will return the same object without invoking `s.get()` again.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      supplier - the Supplier
      Returns:
      caching Supplier

    • cache

      public static <T> LangUtil.AutoCloseableSupplier<T> cache(Supplier<? extends T> supplier, Consumer<? super T> cleaner)
      Create a lazy, caching, and auto-closable Supplier. Upon first invocation of `get()`, `s.get()` is called to create the object to be returned. Each subsequent call will return the same object without invoking `s.get()` again. If the supplier is closed, it is reset to uninitialized state and can be reused. A new object will be created when the supplier is reused.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      supplier - the Supplier
      cleaner - the cleanup operation to be executed on `close()`
      Returns:
      caching Supplier

    • getLocaleSuffix

      public static String getLocaleSuffix(Locale locale)
      Get language suffix to use for resource lookup.

      Using Locale.toLanguageTag() does not always work, like for Indonesian which returns "id" whereas the bundle uses "in" as suffix.

      Parameters:
      locale - the locale
      Returns:
      the language suffix as used by the resource bundle

    • getResourceURL

      public static URL getResourceURL(Class<?> cls, String name, Locale locale)
      Get localized resource.

      This method follows the resource bundle lookup algorithm, starting to search from the most specific resource name towards the general one, returning the first found valid URL.

      Implementation note: The suffix is not determined using Locale.toLanguageTag() as that's not how resource bundle lookup works. An example being the Indonesian locale for which Locale.toLanguageTag() returns "id" whereas the bundle uses "in" as suffix.

      Parameters:
      cls - the class for resource loading
      name - the resource name
      locale - the locale
      Returns:
      the URL of the resource
      Throws:
      MissingResourceException - if no resource was found

    • surroundingItems

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object> List<T> surroundingItems(List<? extends T> list, Predicate<? super T> test, int before, int after)
      Filter surrounding items of a list.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the element type
      Parameters:
      list - The unfiltered list
      test - the predicate to use
      before - number of items to accept before each match
      after - number of items to accept after each match
      Returns:
      a list that contains all items within the given range before and after each match

    • surroundingItems

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object> List<T> surroundingItems(List<? extends T> list, Predicate<? super T> test, int before, int after, BiFunction<? super Integer,? super Integer,? extends T> placeHolder)
      Filter surrounding items of a list.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the element type
      Parameters:
      list - The unfiltered list
      test - the predicate to use
      before - number of items to accept before each match
      after - number of items to accept after each match
      placeHolder - generator for placeholder items; first argument is number of items replaced, second one is current item index in original list
      Returns:
      a list that contains all items within the given range before and after each match

    • asUnmodifiableSortedListSet

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends Comparable<T>> ImmutableSortedListSet<T> asUnmodifiableSortedListSet(T... elements)
      Returns an unmodifiable ImmutableSortedListSet containing the specified elements. The elements are sorted according to their natural ordering as defined by the Comparable interface.

      The returned instance implements both the List and SortedSet interfaces. It uses less memory than a TreeSet.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements that extends Comparable to ensure natural ordering
      Parameters:
      elements - the elements to be included in the unmodifiable sorted set
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable SortedSet containing the specified elements, sorted in their natural order

    • isOfKnownImmutableType

      public static boolean isOfKnownImmutableType(@Nullable Object obj)
      Determines if the given object is of a known immutable type. Immutable types are types whose state cannot be modified after they are created.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to evaluate, which may be null
      Returns:
      true if the object is of a known immutable type, false otherwise

    • removeTrailing

      public static <T> void removeTrailing(List<T> list, Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Removes trailing elements from the provided list that match the given predicate.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements in the list
      Parameters:
      list - the list from which trailing elements will be removed
      predicate - a predicate used to test elements; elements matching this predicate will be removed from the end of the list

    • removeLeading

      public static <T> void removeLeading(List<T> list, Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Removes leading elements from the list that satisfy the given predicate. Iterates through the list from the start and removes all consecutive elements that match the predicate until an element does not satisfy the condition.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      list - the list from which leading elements are to be removed
      predicate - the predicate used to test each element for removal

    • removeLeadingAndTrailing

      public static <T> void removeLeadingAndTrailing(List<T> list, Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Removes elements from the beginning and the end of the specified list that match the given predicate.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      list - the list from which leading and trailing elements will be removed
      predicate - the condition used to determine which elements should be removed

    • reverseInPlace

      public static <T> void reverseInPlace(T[] array)
      Reverses the elements of the given array in place. The first element swaps with the last, the second element swaps with the second-to-last, and so on, until the entire array is reversed.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the array.
      Parameters:
      array - The array whose elements will be reversed. This array is modified in place.

    • reverseInPlace

      public static <T> void reverseInPlace(T[] array, int from, int to)
      Reverses the elements of the specified array within the given range in place.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the array elements
      Parameters:
      array - the array whose elements are to be reversed
      from - the starting index of the range, inclusive
      to - the ending index of the range, exclusive; must be greater than or equal to from and less than or equal to the array length
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified range is invalid (i.e., from < 0, from > to, or to > array.length)

    • newUuidV7

      public static UUID newUuidV7()
      Generates a new UUID version 7 (UUIDv7) according to RFC 9562. UUIDv7 is a time-ordered UUID format that uses Unix timestamp with millisecond precision in the most significant 48 bits, followed by a random component.
      Returns:
      a new UUIDv7 with the current timestamp

    • newUuidV7

      public static UUID newUuidV7(Instant timestamp)
      Generates a new UUID version 7 (UUIDv7) according to RFC 9562 with the specified timestamp. UUIDv7 is a time-ordered UUID format that uses Unix timestamp with millisecond precision in the most significant 48 bits, followed by a random component.
      Parameters:
      timestamp - the timestamp to use for the UUID
      Returns:
      a new UUIDv7 with the specified timestamp

    • newUuidV7

      public static UUID newUuidV7(long unixTimestampMs)
      Generates a new UUIDv7 based on the provided Unix timestamp in milliseconds. UUIDv7 incorporates a 48-bit timestamp derived from Unix epoch time, ensuring temporal ordering when UUIDs are generated.
      Parameters:
      unixTimestampMs - the Unix timestamp in milliseconds to be embedded into the UUID. It must not exceed the 48-bit limit (up to 281474976710655 milliseconds since epoch). If the value exceeds the permissible range, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Returns:
      a new UUIDv7 with the specified timestamp and randomly generated portions for uniqueness and compliance with the UUIDv7 specification.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided timestamp exceeds the allowable 48-bit limit.

    • getTimestampRaw

      public static long getTimestampRaw(UUID uuid)
      Extracts the raw timestamp value from the given UUID.

      For UUIDv7, this returns the 48-bit Unix timestamp in milliseconds since the epoch (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z). For UUIDv1, this returns the 60-bit timestamp in 100-nanosecond intervals since the UUID epoch (1582-10-15T00:00:00Z), as defined by RFC 4122.

      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID from which to extract the raw timestamp
      Returns:
      the raw timestamp value encoded in the UUID
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the UUID version does not include a timestamp (e.g. v4, v8)

    • getTimestampAsInstant

      public static Instant getTimestampAsInstant(UUID uuid)
      Converts the timestamp in the given UUID to a Instant.

      For UUIDv7, this returns an Instant from the embedded Unix millisecond timestamp. For UUIDv1, this returns an Instant converted from 100-nanosecond intervals since the UUID epoch (1582-10-15T00:00:00Z).

      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID containing a timestamp
      Returns:
      the extracted timestamp as an Instant
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the UUID version does not support timestamp extraction (e.g. v4, v8)

      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID to be converted to a byte array
      Returns:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a UUID created from the byte array.
      Throws:

    • mapNonNull

      public static <T, U extends @Nullable Object> U mapNonNull(@Nullable T value, Function<T,U> mapper)
      Applies the given mapping function to the provided value if it is not null. If the value is null, returns null directly.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input value
      U - the type of the result produced by the mapping function
      Parameters:
      value - the input value to be mapped, can be null
      mapper - the function to apply to the input value, must not be null
      Returns:
      the result of applying the mapper function to the value, or null if the value is null

    • mapNonNullOrElse

      public static <T, U> U mapNonNullOrElse(@Nullable T value, Function<T,U> mapper, U ifNull)
      Applies the given mapping function to the provided non-null value, returning the result, or returns a default value if the input is null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input value
      U - the type of the output value
      Parameters:
      value - the input value to map, which may be null
      mapper - the function used to transform the non-null input value
      ifNull - the default value to return if the input value is null
      Returns:
      the result of applying the mapper function to the input value if it is non-null; otherwise, the default value

    • mapNonNullElseGet

      public static <T, U> U mapNonNullElseGet(@Nullable T value, Function<T,U> mapper, Supplier<U> ifNull)
      Maps a non-null value using the provided mapper function, or supplies a default value if the input value is null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input value
      U - the type of the output value
      Parameters:
      value - the input value which may be null
      mapper - the function to map the input value if it is non-null
      ifNull - the supplier to provide a value if the input value is null
      Returns:
      the result of applying the mapper function to the input value if it is non-null, or the value provided by the supplier if the input value is null

    • naturalOrder

      public static <T> Comparator<@Nullable T> naturalOrder()
      Returns a comparator that compares Comparable objects in their natural order. The returned comparator is null-friendly and considers null to be less than non-null elements.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements to be compared, which must implement Comparable
      Returns:
      a comparator that compares objects in their natural order

    • orNaturalOrder

      public static <T> Comparator<@Nullable T> orNaturalOrder(@Nullable Comparator<T> comparator)
      Returns the comparator or if the given comparator is null, return a natural order comparator.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements compared by the comparator
      Parameters:
      comparator - the comparator to use; if null, a natural order comparator is returned
      Returns:
      a comparator that is either the provided comparator or a natural order comparator if the provided comparator is null

      Parameters:
      comparator - the comparator to check, which can be null
      Returns:
      true if the comparator is null or represents natural order, false otherwise

    • compare

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object> int compare(@Nullable Comparator<T> comparator, T a, T b)
      Compares two keys using the provided comparator, or the natural order if the comparator is null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the keys being compared
      Parameters:
      comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the keys; if null, the natural order is used
      a - the first key to compare
      b - the second key to compare
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first key is less than, equal to, or greater than the second key

    • getOrThrow

      public static <T, U> U getOrThrow(Map<T,U> map, T key)
      Retrieves the value for the specified key from the provided map if it exists and is nnon-null. If no value is found for the key or the value is null, a NoSuchElementException is thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the map's key type
      U - the map's value type
      Parameters:
      map - the map to search for the key-value pair
      key - the key whose presence and associated value are to be checked
      Returns:
      the key if a value is successfully associated with it in the map
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if no value is found for the specified key in the map

    • getOrThrow

      public static <T, U, E extends Exception> U getOrThrow(Map<T,U> map, T key, Function<T,E> exceptionBuilder) throws E
      Retrieves the value for the specified key from the provided map if it exists and is nnon-null. If no value is found for the key or the value is null, a NoSuchElementException is thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the map's key type
      U - the map's value type
      E - the exception type
      Parameters:
      map - the map to search for the key-value pair
      key - the key whose presence and associated value are to be checked
      exceptionBuilder - builder for exceptions; the key is passed as argument
      Returns:
      the key if a value is successfully associated with it in the map
      Throws:
      E - if no value is found for the specified key in the map

    • addIf

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends @Nullable Object> boolean addIf(boolean condition, Collection<? super T> collection, T... items)
      Adds the specified items to the collection if the given condition is true. If the condition is false, no items will be added.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements that can be added to the collection
      Parameters:
      condition - the condition that determines whether the items will be added
      collection - the collection to which the items will be added if the condition is true
      items - the items to be added to the collection if the condition is true
      Returns:
      true if elements were added to the collection, false otherwise

    • addIf

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends @Nullable Object> boolean addIf(Predicate<? super T> predicate, Collection<? super T> collection, @Nullable T... items)
      Adds the specified items to a collection if they satisfy the given predicate. This method evaluates each item using the predicate and adds it to the collection only if the predicate returns true.

      The method returns true if at least one item is successfully added to the collection, otherwise returns false.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements handled by the predicate and collection
      Parameters:
      predicate - a predicate to test each item before adding it to the collection
      collection - the collection to which items should be added if they satisfy the predicate
      items - the items to be evaluated and potentially added to the collection
      Returns:
      true if at least one item was added to the collection; false otherwise

    • addIfNonNull

      @SafeVarargs public static <T extends @Nullable Object> boolean addIfNonNull(Collection<? super T> collection, @Nullable T... items)
      Adds the given non-null items to the collection. Items that are null are ignored.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the collection
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to which non-null items will be added
      items - the items to add to the collection, some of which may be null
      Returns:
      true if the collection was modified as a result of the operation, false otherwise

    • formatThrowable

      public static String formatThrowable(@Nullable Throwable t)
      Formats a Throwable into a string representation, including its message and stack trace, for logging or debugging purposes.
      Parameters:
      t - the Throwable to append. If null, the string "null" will be returned.
      Returns:
      a string representation of the given throwable, including its message and stack trace, or "null" if the throwable is null.

    • appendThrowable

      public static <T extends Appendable> T appendThrowable(@Nullable Throwable t, T app) throws IOException
      Appends the details of a Throwable to the provided Appendable instance. This includes the exception's class name, its message, and its stack trace.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the Appendable instance.
      Parameters:
      t - the Throwable to append. If null, the string "null" will be appended.
      app - the Appendable instance to which the throwable's details are appended.
      Returns:
      the same Appendable instance passed in the app parameter.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing to the Appendable.
